<OLD>

> Tucson raises a brow after hearing Silverbolt's encouraging words.=

>
> " I can't hide anything can I? A good friend always knows what his com=
rade is thinking, and no matter how saddened one is, he can always feel goo=
d that he has friends standing beside him. It's very good to know I have yo=
u and the others for support. I should consider myself very lucky to be a p=
art of a powerful merger of factions. Now, Rodimus's health is declining, a=
nd I have more than enough spark to share. I think it is time that you allo=
w me to attempt a form of energy transfusion. It may be his only hope of re=
covery."

<NEW>

Silverbolt turned to face Tuscon a look of surprise crossi=
ng across
his expressive features as he nodded at Tuscon, "Those of valor m=
ust
act as one." he said. "I heard the cracking of your knuckes and I know
=
why we are here, and I know whoes black energon pump is behind this."
Silve=
rbolt's optics darkened as he turned back to look at Rodimus
through the gl=
ass as the alarm went off.

<OLD>

> He establishes a com link to Stanton a=
nd Legacy.
>
> "Stanton, Legacy, I am more than honored to have you working=
 so diligantly on saving Rodimus Prime, and now it is my turn to give somet=
hing back in exchange for the undaunting dedication you are showing our fac=
tions. My spark has more than enough power to transfuse energy from my body=
 into his. Not to worry, I will not go off line. It may be our only hope of=
 saving Rodimus Prime. It is not a request, it is my order."

<NEW>

Santon=
 looked up at Tuscon through the window, his optics at first
annoyed to hav=
e been pulled away from these delicate proceedures by
Tuscon. Everyone knew=
 well the folly of trying to order a medical
officer in his own bay. But th=
en Santon smiled slightly and nodded,
"You're right. We need you . . . but =
only you. Step inside."

Legacy and Bump continued to work on Rodimus, even=
 as Rodimus' life
signs edged a little lower.

(TAG)

Preston
